cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northwest across the eastern / northern Gulf of Mexico, then turning north to make landfall in the western Florida Panhandle before weakening and lifting north-northeast through Alabama-Georgia toward Tennessee and the central Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City–Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Panhandle from the Alabama/Florida border to Navarre (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass FL to Yankeetown FL (storm-surge warning) and Navarre FL to Wakulla/Jefferson County line FL (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Alabama eastward across the Florida Big Bend
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no wind-probability point near Cleveland listed)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (remnants expected to bring 1-3 inches at most in northern Ohio)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (fresh-water port on Lake Erie, far from surge zone)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty remnants possible, generally 20–30 mph Wednesday
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain possible Wednesday, with local 1–3 in totals and minor urban/poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reduced visibility, lightning, and isolated embedded thunderstorms may disrupt cargo-handling during heaviest rain bands
